verses.roman:
tato rathād avaplutya
khaḍga-pāṇir jighāṁsayā
kṛṣṇam abhyadravat kruddhaḥ
pataṅga iva pāvakam

synonyms: tataḥ—then; rathāt—from his chariot; avaplutya—leaping down; khaḍga—a sword; paṇiḥ—in his hand; jighāṁsayā—with the desire to kill; kṛṣṇam—Lord Kṛṣṇa; abhyadravat—he ran toward; kruddhaḥ—furious; pataṅgaḥ—a bird; iva—as; pāvakam—the wind.
translation: Then Rukmī leaped down from his chariot and, sword in hand, rushed furiously toward Kṛṣṇa to kill Him, like a bird flying into the wind.
